description: Time stamp for when the fault occurred.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapEventTime

description: The message ID that can be used to get additional information about
the problem from Sun's knowledge article database. This object will
have a value of NULL if the system doesn't support this
information.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapFaultMessageID

description: The universal unique identifier that was assigned to this fault. This
object will have a value of NULL if the system doesn't support this
information.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapFaultUUID

description: Knowledge article URL.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapKaUrl

description: A textual description of the fault.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapFaultDescription

description: An indication of the severity of the notfication.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSeverity

description: Product manufacturer
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapProductManufacturer

description: A text string containing the product name. When combined with the
sunHwTrapChassisId, it unambiguously identifies the system. If the
source of the trap is a blade, the text string will contain the
chassis product name and the blade product name, in the following
format <chassis-name>::<blade-name>
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapProductName

description: Product serial number
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapProductSn

description: Name and version of the software component that generated
this fault event.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapDiagEntity

description: A text string used to identify the source of the trap. Typically
this is the host name.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSystemIdentifier

description: Hostname of the SP or system
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapHostname

description: The number of suspected faults diagnosed as the cause of
given set of reported hardware errors.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSuspectCnt

description: The percentage likelihood that the fru is the source
of the problem. This object will have a value of 0 if the
system doesn't support this information.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSuspectFruFaultCertainty

description: The class represents a hierarchical classification string indicating
the type of problem detected, as reported by the fault management
subsystem, such as, for instance the Solaris fault manager.
Information on the Solaris fault manager can be found at
http://www.opensolaris.org/os/community/fm.
This object will have a value of NULL if the system doesn't
support this information.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSuspectFruFaultClass

description: The name of the suspect FRU.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSuspectFruName

description: The location of the suspect FRU.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSuspectFruLocation

description: A text string containing the chassis serial number. When combined
with the sunHwTrapProductName, it unambiguously identifies the
system. If the source of the trap is a blade, the text string will
contain the chassis serial number and the blade serial number, in
the following format <chassis-serial-number::blade-serial-number>
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSuspectFruChassisId

description: Name of the manufacturer of this FRU/CRU.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSuspectFruManufacturer

description: Number used to order a FRU/CRU (i.e 501-7324-06).
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSuspectFruPn

description: 18-character FRU serial number for this FRU/CRU
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSuspectFruSn

description: Revision level.
variables.name: SUN-HW-TRAP-MIB::sunHwTrapSuspectFruRevision

description: Status of FRU.
